Authors: Saputra D., Adiputra I., Gharnaditya D., Budiman P.C., Diana V.
Title: Factors influencing behavioral intention in purchasing groceries through E-commerce XYZ's virtual store
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Saputra, D., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Adiputra, I., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gharnaditya, D., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budiman, P.C., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Diana, V., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research aims to find out the partial and simultaneous effect of Performance Expectancy, Effort Expectancy, Price Value, Facilitating Conditions, Habit, Personal Innovativeness in Information Technology, and Brand Image on Behavioral Intention in purchasing groceries through virtual store. The study was conducted using quantitative method, data collected through questioners distributed to 619 respondents, measured by 5 Point Likert scale and data analyze using multiple regression analysis on UTAUT 2 model. Result of this research showed that all independent variables have significant influence both partially and simultaneously on dependent variable, with Effort Expectancy has the most significant influence and Facilitating Conditions has the least significant influence on Behavioral Intention. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Behavioral intention; Multiple regression; Personal innovativeness; UTAUT2; Virtual store
Index Keywords: Behavioral intention; Dependent variables; Facilitating conditions; Independent variables; Multiple regression analysis; Personal innovativeness; Quantitative method; Simultaneous effects; Information management

Authors: Nurcahyo R., Gharnaditya D., Surya A., Natalia G.
Title: Digital marketing business strategy in indonesia
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Authors with affiliations: Nurcahyo, R., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Gharnaditya, D., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Surya, A., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Natalia, G., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: This research aims to provide input to PT. ABC Indonesia in the digital marketing industry about a strategy that will provide competitive advantage from other competing companies in the digital marketing industry. The data processed with descriptive qualitative methods of Milles and Huberman,The data collected based on primary and secondary data through direct interviews with companies in the digital marketing industry to look at external and internal factors that include PESTLE (Political, Economic, Social, Technological, Legal, Environmental), 5 Forces Porter, RBV (Resource Based View) methods at PT. ABC Indonesia . Recommendation Strategy based on VRIO (Valuable, Rare, and Imitability Organized) to see the resources are a competitive disadvantage, competitive advantage parity, or sustainable competitive advantage and SWOT (Strength, Weakness, Opportunities, Threat) matrix to see and create alternative strategies that can be implemented firmly. © ITRC 2020.
Author Keywords: Competitive Advantage; Competitive Disadvantage; Strategy; SWOT; VRIO

Authors: Novela S., Gharnaditya D., Novita, Wibisono P.M.
Title: Consumer perceived value, attitude, trust and purchase intention of Kuku Bima Ener-G product
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21, Alam Sutera-Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Novela, S., Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21, Alam Sutera-Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia; Gharnaditya, D., Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21, Alam Sutera-Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia; Novita, Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21, Alam Sutera-Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia; Wibisono, P.M., Department of Management, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Jalur Sutera Barat Kav.21, Alam Sutera-Tangerang, 15143, Indonesia
Abstract: Consumers are the target of all marketing activities; thus, it is important for marketers to understand consumer behaviours and perceptions. These considerations relate to a consumer's desire to purchase a product. The purpose of this study is to know the perception from the consumer profile, in this case, the socioeconomic characteristics of respondents toward a popular energy drink brand from Sido Muncul, i.e., Kuku Bima Ener-G, and to identify the impact of all variables, i.e., perceived value, attitude, and trust, toward purchase intention of that product as well. The research methods used are descriptive analysis and multiple regression. Using the nonprobability sampling technique to gather 181 respondents, the results obtained the three dominant factors from each variable and a description of the dominant characteristics from respondents; thus, we found a significant influence among all independent variables on purchasing decisions of energy drinks products. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press
Author Keywords: Consumer behaviour; Consumer profile; Energy drink; Purchase intention
Funding Text 1: The authors wish to acknowledge and thank all IMHA 2018 committee members and UPM Pertanika journal team that help publish this article.

Authors: Saputra D., Arief M., Gharnaditya D., Vhany D.
Title: Mediating effect of job satisfaction on relation between power distance and collectivism toward employee performance in Indonesia
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Doctoral of Research in Management, Binus Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Saputra, D., Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Arief, M., Doctoral of Research in Management, Binus Graduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Gharnaditya, D., Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Vhany, D., Management Department, Binus Business School Undergraduate, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to analyse the mediating effect of job satisfaction on the relations between cultural dimensions of power distance and collectivism toward employee performance in a public insurance company in Indonesia. The study uses associative and quantitative approach, where data is collected by distributing questionnaires to 153 employees of this company. The data is later analysed using simple regression and path analysis. The findings showed that job satisfaction plays a mediating role between Power Distance, Collectivism and Employee performance. In addition, this study confirmed that Job Satisfaction is important for enhancing employee performance. The Power Distance has both direct and indirect (due to effect on job satisfaction) effects on employee performance. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Collectivism; Employee performance; Job satisfaction; Power distance
